title: Ousmane Dembele named Fifa Best men's player of the year
description: Paris St-Germain and France forward Ousmane Dembele has been named the men's player of the year at the Fifa Best awards.
content:
Paris St-Germain and France forward Ousmane Dembele has been named the men's player of the year at the Fifa Best awards.
The 28-year-old, who won the Ballon d'Or in September, picked up the award in Qatar on Tuesday after helping PSG to four trophies... [475 chars]

title: Susie Wiles: Trump's chief of staff hits back at Vanity Fair 'hit piece'
description: In the interview, Wiles describes Donald Trump as having an "alcoholic's personality" and JD Vance as having been a "conspiracy theorist" for a decade.
content:
White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles has disputed portions of a Vanity Fair article in which she paints an unflattering picture of the Trump administration and many of its top officials.

title: DR Congo conflict: Rebels say they will withdraw from Uvira city at Trump administration's request
description: The US accuses Rwanda of backing the rebel advance in breach of a deal brokered by President Trump.
content:
A rebel leader in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo says his fighters will withdraw from a key city at the request of the US.
Corneille Nangaa's statement came days after US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the capture of Uvira by rebel forces ... [2937 chars]

title: EU waters down plans to end new petrol and diesel car sales by 2035
description: Carmakers, particularly in Germany, have lobbied heavily for concessions to the planned rules.
content:
The European Commission has watered down its plans to ban the sale of new petrol and diesel vehicles by 2035.
Current rules state that new vehicles sold from that date should be "zero emission", but carmakers, particularly in Germany, have lobbied he... [4160 chars]

title: Dad Paul Doyle jailed after using car 'as a weapon' to hit Liverpool fans at title parade
description: A dad who used a car as a "weapon" screaming at Liverpool fans to "get out the f****** way" as they celebrated has been jailed for more than 20 years. | ITV News Granada
content:
ITV Granada Reports journalist Zoe Muldoon was in court for Paul Doyle's sentencing
